channel.description: Recent content in Posts on codeskraps

item.title: When .gitignore Doesnt Seem to Work: A Quick Fix
item.author: me@codeskraps.com (codeskraps)
item.description: As developers, we’ve all been there. You’ve added a file or folder to your .gitignore, but Git keeps tracking it anyway. What gives? Let’s dive into why this happens and how to fix it.

item.title: Configuring SSH Keys for Individual Git Commands
item.author: me@codeskraps.com (codeskraps)
item.description: When working with Git repositories, you often need to authenticate using SSH keys. While you can configure SSH settings globally, there are times when you need to use a specific SSH key for just one command. This is particularly useful when cloning a new repository or adding a submodule, where there isn’t yet a local .git/config file to modify.

item.title: Simplifying MVI Architecture
item.author: me@codeskraps.com (codeskraps)
item.description: Model-View-Intent (MVI) is a powerful architectural pattern for building user interfaces, especially in Android development. In this post, we’ll explore a helper class that simplifies the implementation of MVI, making it easier to manage state, handle user intents, and emit actions in your application.
